说服性沟通(persuasive communication): 在某一问题上支持特定观点的沟通,如演讲或电视广告。 耶鲁态度改变研究法(Yale attitude change approach): 研究人们在何种.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin persuasio(n-), from the verb persuadere (see persuade)

entry.def: Persuasion is the act of persuading someone to do something or to believe that something is true.

example.ex: Only after much persuasion from Ellis had she agreed to hold a show at all...
example.tran: 埃利斯劝了她半天后她才同意办一场展览。

example.ex: She was using all her powers of persuasion to induce the Griffins to remain in Rollway.
example.tran: 她在极力劝说格里芬斯一家留在罗尔威。

entry.def: If you are of a particular persuasion, you have a particular belief or set of beliefs.

example.ex: It is a national movement and has within it people of all political persuasions...
example.tran: 这是一场全国性运动，参加者的政治信仰各不相同。

example.ex: Fortunately for me, my kids are of the persuasion that their failings are of their own making.
example.tran: 对我来说幸运的是,我的孩子们相信失败是他们自己造成的。

means.word_mean: 1. the act of persuading (or attempting to persuade); communication intended to induce belief or action
2. a personal belief or judgment that is not founded on proof or certainty;
3. inducement to act by argument or reasoning or entreaty

Sentence.sentence: Mr Jobs was said by an engineer in the early years of Apple to emit a "reality distortion （扭曲）field", such were his powers of persuasion.

sentences.cn: 经过多方劝说, 他才决定离开。

jushi.english: It is my persuasion that truth will triumph in the end.
There is still time to win him back by gentle persuasion.
jushi.chinese: 还有时间通过婉言说服工作把他争取回来。
